A **stone giant**, H, is a type of [monster](/wiki/Monster "Monster") that appears in *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")*. The stone giant is a [giant humanoid](/wiki/Giant_humanoid "Giant humanoid") that is slightly stronger than the [hill giant](/wiki/Hill_giant "Hill giant"), though it also has the lowest [difficulty](/wiki/Monster_difficulty "Monster difficulty") of its monster class. Like all living [giants](/wiki/Giant_\(monster_attribute\) "Giant (monster attribute)"), stone giants have [infravision](/wiki/Infravision "Infravision") and can be seen via infravision; they will seek out [gems](/wiki/Gems "Gems") and other items to pick up, and can move over [boulders](/wiki/Boulder "Boulder"), pick them up and throw them.

A stone giant has a single weapon attack.

[Eating](/wiki/Eating "Eating") a stone giant [corpse](/wiki/Corpse "Corpse") or [tin](/wiki/Tin "Tin") has a 1⁄2 chance (50%) of increasing a character's [strength](/wiki/Strength "Strength").

*The following information pertains to an upcoming version ([3.7.0](/wiki/3.7.0 "3.7.0")). If this version is now released, please verify that it is still accurate, then update the page to incorporate this information.*

The attacks of stone giants and other sufficiently large monsters can inflict knockback, sending targets flying one or more squares.

Stone giants and other large humanoids can wear mummy wrappings.

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Generation](#Generation)

- [2 Strategy](#Strategy)

## Generation

Stone giants may generate as peaceful towards lawful characters, and can generate in small [groups](/wiki/Groups "Groups") of two to four.

Stone giants may appear among the hostile giant humanoids generated in [throne rooms](/wiki/Throne_room "Throne room") at dungeon levels 13 and below, and can also appear among the monsters randomly generated by [looting](/wiki/Looting "Looting") a [throne](/wiki/Throne "Throne") while [confused](/wiki/Confused "Confused") and carrying gold (provided there is no [chest](/wiki/Chest "Chest") on the level).[\[1\]](#cite_note-1)

Stone giants may appear among the random H that are part of the second quest monster class for [Cavepeople](/wiki/Cavepeople "Cavepeople"), and make up 6⁄175 (\~3.42%) of the monsters randomly generated on the [Caveman quest](/wiki/Caveman_quest "Caveman quest"). Stone giants may also appear among the random H that are part of the second quest monster class for [Valkyries](/wiki/Valkyrie "Valkyrie"), and make up 6⁄175 (\~3.42%) of the monsters that are randomly generated on the [Valkyrie quest](/wiki/Valkyrie_quest "Valkyrie quest").

A stone giant is placed in the northwestern room of [Fort Ludios](/wiki/Fort_Ludios "Fort Ludios") on the other end of the secret passage at level creation, and five stone giants are generated on the [Plane of Earth](/wiki/Plane_of_Earth "Plane of Earth") at level creation.

Stone giants have a 1⁄2 chance (50%) of [being generated with](/wiki/Monster_starting_inventory "Monster starting inventory") either a boulder or a [club](/wiki/Club "Club") with equal probability, and an independent chance of being generated with a small assortment of gems.[\[2\]](#cite_note-2)[\[3\]](#cite_note-3) They are eligible for [offensive items](/wiki/Offensive_item "Offensive item"), [defensive items](/wiki/Defensive_item "Defensive item"), and [miscellaneous items](/wiki/Miscellaneous_item "Miscellaneous item").

## Strategy

Though usually considered the weakest of the giants, stone giants have a natural [AC](/wiki/AC "AC") of 0, which is the best among giants and second-best among giant humanoids after the [titan](/wiki/Titan "Titan"). This can make them troublesome to dispatch, especially if they find enchanted armor that fits and/or have any attack [wands](/wiki/Wand "Wand") on hand. However, stone giants have no [MR score](/wiki/Magic_resistance_\(monster\) "Magic resistance (monster)") and are also the slowest among their monster type and class at 6 speed, which makes them much easier to handle with wands and spells.

*The following information pertains to an upcoming version ([3.7.0](/wiki/3.7.0 "3.7.0")). If this version is now released, please verify that it is still accurate, then update the page to incorporate this information.*

Knockback can make stone giants and other large monsters exceedingly dangerous if the player character is positioned between them and a hazard, such as [pools](/wiki/Pool "Pool") of water or [lava](/wiki/Lava "Lava").

## History

The stone giant first appears in [NetHack 3.0.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.0.0 "NetHack 3.0.0").

The stone giant residing in the northwest room of [Fort Ludios](/wiki/Fort_Ludios "Fort Ludios") is added in [NetHack 3.6.1](/wiki/NetHack_3.6.1 "NetHack 3.6.1") via [commit 5addbf88](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/commit/5addbf88ddd3aa7f805f9f888c37fd868c907827).

## Variants

### SLASH'EM

In [SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM"), two stone giants are generated within an inner room in [Grund's Stronghold](/wiki/Grund%27s_Stronghold "Grund's Stronghold") at level creation. Stone giants may also appear among the random H generated in [giant courts](/wiki/Giant_court "Giant court") and the [Giant Caverns](/wiki/Giant_Caverns "Giant Caverns").

All of the above information also applies to [SlashTHEM](/wiki/SlashTHEM "SlashTHEM") and [Hack'EM](/wiki/Hack%27EM "Hack'EM").

### dNetHack

In [dNetHack](/wiki/DNetHack "DNetHack"), [notdNetHack](/wiki/NotdNetHack "NotdNetHack") and [notnotdNetHack](/wiki/NotnotdNetHack "NotnotdNetHack"), stone giants are neutral-aligned and vulnerable to [iron](/wiki/Iron "Iron"). They have an additional 1⁄4 chance (25%) of being generated with a club, due to an oversight in the code.

Stone giants may appear among the court of a [titan](/wiki/Titan "Titan")-ruled [throne room](/wiki/Throne_room#dNetHack "Throne room").

### NetHack Fourk

[NetHack Fourk](/wiki/NetHack_Fourk "NetHack Fourk") removes the stone giant in favor of using the "standard" [giant](/wiki/Giant_\(monster\) "Giant (monster)") due to its identical stats - giants are generated in the same locations that stone giants are in *NetHack*.

## Encyclopedia entry

Giants have always walked the earth, though they are rare in these times. They range in size from little over nine feet to a towering twenty feet or more. The larger ones use huge boulders as weapons, hurling them over large distances. All types of giants share a love for men - roasted, boiled, or fried. Their table manners are legendary.
